phrases: OP
Eyecatch
Insert Song
End of Insert song
ED
I have said it plenty of times already, but it is not a good idea to be serialized while you are still going to school.
Niizuma-san is doing it, is not he?
And by himself!
All right, but I have two conditions.
Conditions?
Firstly, for the next Golden Future Cup, submit this as a one-shot and get good results.
Golden Future Cup?
That is in the summer, is not it?
And I have something for you to do until then.
At the pace of one every two weeks...
write and bring in mangas 19 pages long each.
Even without having serialization decided?
That is right.
Do you guys normally go this far?
We do not.
But I want to go that far.
If you cannot do that much, you cannot draw a series while going to high school.
It is unfortunate, but I think you two are different from Niizuma-kun.
And the way detective stories are made is completely different from how battle stories are made.
But even if what you write does not get serialized, your efforts definitely have not been in vain.
Thank you very much.
We will do it!
I am sure we can!
And then we will definitely grab serialization!
I lost in the rankings for NEXT!, but there is no way I will lose this time, Ashirogi Muto!
The curry's finished!
Oh, thank you.
It is making me hungry.
Thanks for the meal!
Eh?
It is cold!
It is hiya-atsu curry!
TL note:Hiya-atsu (cold-hot) is a cooking style with cold ingredients in a hot broth.
It is just regular cold curry, is not it?
But I put in all the soup stock and the curry powder.
Then added plenty of meat and onions.
It was a lot of work.
You want some curry, Mashiro?
Are you not eating?
Ah, I will have some.
Miho told me she landed another role.
Oh, glad to hear it.
She is doing pretty well.
I got a message about it too.
Mashiro, at least during meals, could you...
The deadline's tomorrow.
We have to finish today.
But we have midterms too, and there have not been any holidays either.
Cannot you at least get a one-day extension?
Deadlines are absolute.
I guess you cannot be carefree even after you have been decided as an entrant.
Are you choking?!
No, it is just that when I think of running in Jack,
it makes me feel pressured, like we need to be popular and get the top spot in the Golden Future Cup.
Manga really is a competition to be the most popular, is not it?
How many are there besides you?
I forgot to ask.
Maybe I will call Hattori-san now and ask.
It is fine, we will just ask him tomorrow in person.
Do you think you will get the manuscript done in time?
If I do not sleep.
If you do not sleep?!
But did not you go without sleep yesterday too?!
You too, Takagi.
Being a mangaka means drawing works that cut down on your lifespan.
I thought we might not make it.
Good job.
Ah, oh man!
Huh?
Just this afternoon you said you had not even heard of KOOGY.
Ah, well, I think he is kind of cool after all.
I am going to see him live today.
Seriously?!
Have you thought up the next story?
For the most part.
I will finish it by the end of the school day.
Hey, are you all right?
Somehow...
We have got three months until the results for the Golden Future Cup come out.
Until then, we have to do one work consisting of 19 pages every two weeks.
So we have got six in total left to do...
We have to do at least this much,
otherwise we will not be able to be serialized while going to high school.
I know.
We have finally made it this far.
We have to...
Huh?
Nakai-san?
That really good assistant you were talking about?
Yeah.
The one who was crying about how he wanted to get serialized?
Looks like spring has sprung for him.
No, it is probably a meeting or something.
There is no way there is an editor that young and cute.
Yeah.
Now that you mention it, she kind of looks like Iwase.
No, I did not mean it like that.
Oh, if it is not Mashiro-kun!
It is been a while.
Are you having a meeting for the Golden Future Cup?
This is bad, we have been spotted.
Why is it bad?
It just is.
Yeah, we have got one at Yuueisha at 6.
Want To have a little chat together?
Or because we are rivals in the Golden Future Cup, do you not want to?
Eh?
You are in it too?
Let me introduce you.
This is the person who took the runner-up spot for last year's Story King, Aoki Kou-san.
For the longest time she did not have an artist to draw her story, but I have since stepped up.
And we got entered in the Golden Future Cup.
I happen to be looking for someone to do the artwork for the second place winner of the Story King for the name category.
I see.
The person from back then, huh?
This is the person whom I taught a few things to while he was an assistant on CROW for a time, Mashiro-kun.
You were a big help, Nakai-san!
I learned a lot from you.
It was nothing...
So, you are the one teamed up with Mashiro-kun...
Takagi, it is nice to meet you.
And your two-man team is called Ashirogi Muto, right?
So you are Ashirogi-san?
Kono Yo wa Kane to Chie?
I did not think it was very good.
She said that right to our faces?
I did not think it was the right kind of story for a shounen magazine.
It was too bleak.
Excuse me, but what kind of story are you doing, Aoki-san?
Do not get angry...
To classify it simply, it is a fantasy.
I was working with Magnolia, a shoujo magazine, but...
TL note: Magnolia is a parody of Margaret, Shuueisha's bi-weekly shoujo (young-girl demographic) magazine.
they said I would be better off doing this kind of fantasy story in a shounen magazine.
I cannot tell you any of the details yet,
but it is a really great escapist fantasy.
I was introduced to Jack in order to have my name made into a completed work.
Because the drawings were not the right style for a shounen manga.
But she can draw really cute female characters.
Aoki-san is just going to draw the under-sketches for the girls' faces, and I will be doing the rest.
I am betting my life as a mangaka on this work with Aoki-san!
If I fail here, I will live my whole life as an assistant or go home to the countryside!
Life as a mangaka?
He has not even debuted yet, has he?
Still, I cannot believe I am up against Fukuda-kun and Ashirogi-kun like this.
Ah, so Fukuda-san got in too?
Yeah, there is no way I will lose to him.
Although, unfortunately, the editorial department has the highest expectations for him.
They really think he will win?
Have you heard about the order they are running them in the main magazine?
The order they are running in?
We have not even heard who the entrants are, let alone their order.
There are four works entered in total.
Combined issue 37-38 is Fukuda-kun's Kiyoshi Knight.
Issue 39 is you two's Gitantei TRAP.
Issue 40 is our hideout door.
Issue 41 is Makino Kouji's Colorfusical.
The work they have the highest hopes for runs first.
Does the order they are run in really matter?
Well, it makes sense that it would, does not it?
It is called the Golden Future Cup.
They want to get the reader's attention with their top batter first.
Recently, the works Nurarihyon no Mago and Beelzebub ran first in them and got good results.
Well, even though I think running first may give it that extra something, beyond that I do not think it matters.
It is a question of whether we can beat Fukuda-kun.
He does not even consider us a threat.
But I read Fukuda-san's one-shot.
I do not think I have read anything in Jack as defiant and exciting as that in a long time.
It got 7th place in the questionnaire rankings, but that was good enough to get submitted to a serialization meeting.
And he is powered that up for this, so of course they will be expecting the most from it.
I did not like that work either.
It seemed like he was trying to portray modern city youths,
but in a shounen magazine, they do not even want you to use words like drugs.
If he really must draw like that, then he is better off doing so in a seinen magazine.
Yeah, I think so too.
I much prefer your escapist work, Aoki-san.
Colorfusical, that took second prize in the last Tezuka Award and was run in the magazine, right?
Yeah, it did.
Makaino Kouji...
Was not that...
the one about the guy who was changing the world by
changing the colors of things with his eyes and changing people's hearts with his singing voice?
It did not really hit home with me, but it did well in the questionnaires.
I thought that the artwork was original, but it felt more like it should be in a picture book or a musical rather than a manga.
It was too surreal, which made it not so good.
I liked it.
It was artistic.
You could feel the hopes and dreams in it.
Yeah, yeah.
You are right, manga has to make you feel hopes and dreams, does not it?
Like our work does.
Aw man, it is already past 6!
Well, we will be taking our leave now.
Hello?
Yes, sorry, we will be right there.
Yeah, let us both give it our all okay?
Right.
Go easy on us.
See you later.
As an original author, I really do not want to lose to that Aoki.
And I am letting Nakai-san pay for our coffee.
But those two seem kind of hard to beat.
Yeah, they are definitely worthy opponents.
The Story King runner-up king's story combined with Nakai-san's drawing talent,
backgrounds and finishing touches...
That is not what I meant.
Nakai-san has a crush on Aoki-san, does not he?
Yeah, he does.
He sure does, he was agreeing with everything she said.
It got me worried.
It is not something for us to butt into.
Aoki-san's doing the story, so there is nothing wrong with her taking the lead.
I guess.
We have got our own work to worry about anyhow.
Good, you certainly got it done within two weeks this time too.
Both the artwork and story are OK.
Then next, we will have the meeting for the next 19 pages.
I have got the general idea written out.
No.
Starting now, we are having meetings aimed towards serialization.
By that...
Do you mean...
Mhm!
Now that you have been entered in for the Golden Future Cup, let us get ready for serialization.
Does that mean we do not need to write a chapter once every two weeks anymore?
I can see how serious you are already.
Starting from here, we should concentrate wholeheartedly on getting serialized.
That is okay, right?
Yeah.
Thank you very much!
We would love to!
Aw, uh-oh.
The second I thought that I did not have to draw anymore, my body suddenly lost all its strength.
You guys sure have been working hard.
It must have been tough.
Even though he finally acknowledged that we can do this, I cannot collapse right now...
Well, if we could not do this much, we knew we could not get serialized.
So if we get first in the Golden Future Cup, then you will send in our work to get passed around for the serialization meeting?
Yes.
I would really like for you to get first, but you do not have to do that good.
For the issues in which the Golden Future Cup entries run, the questionnaire cards are different from normal.
They have an item that asks whether you endorse or do not endorse the relevant manga.
Yes, we know.
We look at that endorsement percentage as well as the rank it gets as a manga.
In order to be impartial, right?
Right.
The entries do not all appear in the same issue, so it is possible they could get the same ranking.
Plus, they can also be affected by the quality of the running serialized works.
That is why we have the endorsement percentage.
Speaking of which, in scenarios where one work has a high endorsement percentage but a low ranking...
and clashes with a work that has a low endorsement percentage but a high ranking,
the editorial department has to choose which to place the crown of number one on and have a big announcement for.
Um...
About the endorsement percentages,
the work that is run first has an advantage, does not it?
From the second one onward,
they compare them to what was run previously in order to decide whether to endorse them or not.
I had not thought it through that far, but you may be right.
The fact that something like that comes into your head so quickly
really shows that you have great talent as an original author.
You can definitely get popular with a detective story!
Is he trying to fool us?
Anyway, it is not like you have to get first or you will not be good enough.
There are lots of series like Muhyo to Rouji no Mahouritsu Soudan Jimusho that did not get first but still got serialized.
I have only read them at the name stages at this point
but honestly, the entries this time are so good it will be hard to choose which are better.
Though, to be blunt,
you could see appearing in the Golden Future Cup as if each entry runs as a separate one-shot.
If you get good results and make a well put-together name, you have a chance at getting serialized.
However, we really should hope you get first place.
Everyone is worked really hard, but I do not think any of them have been preparing for serialization like you have.
And personally, I really do not want to lose to a work like Colorfusical.
Colorfusical?
I liked it.
Why is that?
Ah, no, forget I said that.
Is he that strong a foe?
Sorry, it really was just a personal thought.
We will take first.
We are going to take first and get serialized soon.
I want to catch up to Niizuma Eiji!
Niizuma-kun, huh?
He really did turn out to be a genius.
CROW is popular and usually in the upper ranks.
And the three volumes of his manga have already sold over two million in total...
Not even the editorial department thought he would do this well.
They are even doing additional printings to meet demand.
Two million...
An author gets 42 yen in royalties for one volume.
Incredible!
Cut it out...
It seems he is even gotten an offer for an anime.
An anime, huh?
Azuki's always working hard and getting roles too...
Okay, I have got it.
Let us get first place!
I am sorry for saying something passive like
It is okay even if you do not get first.
I want to catch up with Niizuma-kun too.
No, I want to surpass him!
The first time you guys brought something into the editorial department...
I caused a big stir in front of a captain.
Hey, how did it go?
With the middle school pair?
No good, at least not yet.
I guess not everyone can be Niizuma Eiji.
But...
I think that in three years, they will surpass Niizuma Eiji.
Even now, I do not think I was wrong.
Hattori-san...
Three years... it may already be too late to make that...
But someday we will surpass him!
Okay, let us do it no matter what it takes!
I knew I could depend on you guys.
Now, keep that spirit up and get working on the manuscript for the Golden Future Cup!
And as soon as that is done, let us polish up your serialization names!
Yes, sir!
After today, I was thankful from the bottom of my heart that we have Hattori-san as an editor.
Do not you agree, Saikou?
The one who the editorial department has the highest hopes for is Fukuda-san.
And the Nakai-san Aoki-san team's drawing ability is nothing to sneeze at either.
And then there is Makaino Kouji with his original world.
We have got no shortage of strong opponents!
DO NOT BE AFRAID
Come here, if you leave my side
you will be devoured.
SHALL WE DANCE?
SHALL WE DAN CE?
in Hell.
If it feels like we are in paradise, your eyes open.
Hey,
ne e
If you do not like it, if you want out
YOU...
YOU
still cannot leave.
DEEP INTO
DEEP IN TO
THE MIXTURE OF CHAOS
That extacy is
DEEP INTO it, and the SOUND is circling.
It is melting apart.
As you all know, I have been successful in various different fields.
Acting, writing, fashion designing...
I want to represent my world even outside of music.
And that feeling is unending.
The flame continues to burn right in here
in an unending flood.
So much so that even now, I have no hope of stopping it.
Today, there is something I want to tell you all.
Are you listening?
That was a great concert.
I am proud to be your producer, KOOGY.
Hyde?
I will be waiting for you here.
I will definitely come back successful.
Um...
Who are you?
My name is Uchida.
I am an editor at Yuueisha.
Hello?
Did you see today's paper?!
N-No, not yet.
Well go take a look at it!
Or just look on the TV!
Geez, if you are trying to be a mangaka you at least need to look over the paper first thing in the morning.
Ah, sorry.
First thing in the morning?
He woke me up with this phone call.
Today, there is something I want to tell you all.
Are you listening?
With this last concert, I am taking a break from music.
And I, no, Makaino Kouji is...
going to be a mangaka!
Makaino Kouji?!
Yeah.
Colorfusical's author was the singer KOOGY.
He is playing dirty!
He is trying to get his fans to send in questionnaires.
I am so angry that I am thinking about going to the editorial department to protest against it.
I hope you will all support me!
Nakai-san's going too.
But I would not mind even going alone.
Ask Ashirogi-kun, too!
Nakai-san told me you were entered in the Golden Future Cup too.
So I thought I would let you know.
Want To come with us?
We have school.
What time can you come to Yuueisha?
If you are coming, we will wait for you.
Let me just talk it over with Takagi-kun.
Got it.
I will wait till this afternoon for your call.
Okay.
Just like Fukuda-san said, making an announcement at a time like this is unfair.
Yeah, he will definitely get questionnaires from his fans.
The work that comes in first in the Golden Future Cup gets closest to becoming serialized.
Even we want to be number one!
Let us go.
Yeah!
I wish you would have waited until after you were serialized before making an official announcement.
If I am going to do it, now is the only time.
This way all my fans will send in those questionnaires and give me votes.
It is not something that simple...
I can draw artwork this good.
Manga sure is nice.
By being successful in many different fields, I will become a person of real charisma!
Guess the gang's all here.
We cannot let KOOGY's actions go by!
There is no way I could tolerate an announcement like that!
Let us make the editorial department open their eyes.
Fukuda Group, let us go!
You are raiding the editorial department?
Action!
As a male worker, I am going to protest against this!
There must be a better way to do this.
You are so right, Aoki-san!
Next time, Unity and Breakdown.
I will be pursuing my own dream.
